entry.title: We have entered the age of mass subculture.

link.title: We have entered the age of mass subculture.

entry.content:
Since I’ve decided to start writing for the company blog more often, I went with Medium as the platform for the writing and distribution of the articles. It kind of seems like the obvious choice in this day and age.1

However, I wanted to have the latest posts appear on our site as well without any of us needing to update and redeploy the site each time a new article is published because we want to expose the content directly to our visitors who wouldn’t necessarily be inclined to visit the blog specifically.

As it turns out this is not so easy to do, unless you are a developer and know how to work with APIs. Being a designer and a basic front-ender, I figured there has to be a way to do this with the almighty jQuery. After some googling I’ve stumbled upon several hints that made me think it might be possible, and it involves getting JSON-formatted content from Medium, and parsing it into your HTML with jQuery.

entry.content: An exhibition and panel discussion organized as part of the Audi Urban Future Initiative and the New Museum IDEAS CITY festival. The show selected design proposals by five architecture firms that imagined possible scenarios for future transportation in New York City.

entry.title: MoMA P.S.1 Young Architects Program 10th Anniversary Review

link.title: MoMA P.S.1 Young Architects Program 10th Anniversary Review

entry.content: A 10-year retrospective exhibition of the Young Architects Program (YAP) installed at MoMA P.S.1 to celebrate the anniversary of the competition. 40 collected interviews and the thousands of digital images became the basis for MoMA’s YAP digital archive and website.

entry.title: Experiments in Motion
entry.content: A year-long initiative created by Consortia at Columbia University in partnership with Audi of America, which developed a series of experimental concepts and programming to identify new paradigms of motion and mobility in design. Consortia coordinated three graduate architecture studios, created a yearlong digital content series, installed an exhibition of student work, and organized a public events series.

entry.title: Chicago Architecture Biennial
entry.content: Digital content strategy for the first major architecture exhibition in the United States, including social media and promotional trailers. Consortia is editing an online editorial platform featuring diverse voices from across the architecture world on the 2017 edition, Make New History.

entry.title: Audi Round Table
entry.content: Concept and installation design for a round table discussion on early adoption and autonomous driving hosted by Audi at the 2016 Fast Company Innovation Festival and located at Spring Studios. The event featured a custom-built round table, video graphics and presentations by Audi of America President Scott Keogh, New York City Chief Digital Officer Sree Sreenivasan, and design industry leader Doreen Lorenzo.
